result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell Ryan Engebretson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay restitution directly to DOC. Court authorizes DOC to withhold prison wages to pay restitution.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not possess or consumer any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed.
Defendant shall not have any contact with victims or their premises. 
Defendant shall be subject to random observed testing for the presence of controlled substances.

Defendant shall be employed full time at 40 hours a week. If not employed defendant shall seek work at a rate of no less than 3 job applications per week. If interview is offered to attend that interview or explain why the interview was not attended.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: prison and extended supervision sentences in 22CF07, 22CF46, and 22CF54. Probation concurrent with 22CF7.

miscConds.notes: Court waives court costs on all counts.
Defendant shall pay restitution directly to DOC.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not possess or consumer any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed.
Defendant shall not have any contact with victims or their premises. 
Defendant shall be subject to random observed testing for the presence of controlled substances.

Defendant shall be employed full time at 40 hours a week. If not employed defendant shall seek work at a rate of no less than 3 job applications per week. If interview is offered to attend that interview or explain why the interview was not attended.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell Ryan Engebretson

records.addlTxt: Partial Transcript of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held May 25, 2022

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mitchell Ryan Engebretson in court, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Mitchell Ryan Engebretson. Per agreement defendant will be pleading to all counts. State will recommend 2 years WSPS (1in and 1 out) for Ct 1 consecutive to other sentences. For Cts 2, 3, and 4, State will be recommending 2 years probation consecutive to prison sentence. Conditions of probation and extended supervision recommend are: random drug testing, participate in counseling, not to have any contact with victims or their premises, to pay restitution, to be employed full time at 40 hours a week, if not employed defendant shall seek work at a rate of no less than 3 job applications per week. If interview is offered to attend that interview or explain why the interview was not attended. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty to all charges. Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of all charges. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Bartelt heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 2 years WSPS (1in and 1out) for Ct 1, consecutive to current sentence and to 22CF07. Cts 2, 3, and 4 court orders 2 years probation. Conditions of probation and extended supervision are: provide a DNA sample, defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate, defendant shall not possess or consumer any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed, not have any contact with victims or their premises, be subject to random observed testing for the presence of controlled substances, to be employed full time at 40 hours a week. If not employed defendant shall seek work at a rate of no less than 3 job applications per week. If interview is offered to attend that interview or explain why the interview was not attended, to pay restitution, and court costs are waived.

Defendant Mitchell Ryan Engebretson appeared by video, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Mitchell Ryan Engebretson. Amy Hartwig sworn and testified. State offers Exhibit #1: accepted and received. Cross. State moves to bind matter over. Attorney Bartelt objects to bind over and waives argument. Court bind matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Mitchell Ryan Engebretson appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant advised to contact SPD. Attorney Bartelt represents defendant in other cases. State requests $250 cash bond. Defendant is on a probation hold. Court sets bond at $250 cash. Status as to counsel set.
Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
